title: Understanding Substitution
text: When solving systems of equations by substitution, you substitute one variable with an equivalent expression from the other equation. This allows you to solve for the remaining variable.

title: Choose the Right Equation
text: Look at which of the two equations would be easier to solve for one variable. In this case, either can be quickly manipulated to show \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

title: Isolate $$y$$ in the First Equation
text: Rewrite the first equation \(-x+y=-5\) to solve for \(y\). What does it become?

title: Substitution in the Second Equation
text: Substitute $$\(y=x-5\)$$ into the second equation $$\(2x-5y=1\)$$. What is the equation you get after substitution?

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Now solve the equation $$\(2x-5(x-5)=1\)$$ for \(x\). What is the value of \(x\)?

title: Substitute Back to Find $$y$$
text: Substitute $$\(x=8\)$$ back into $$\(y=x-5\)$$ to find \(y\). What is the value of \(y\)?

title: Solution Check
text: It's always good practice to check your solutions. Substitute $$\(x=8\)$$ and $$\(y=3\)$$ back into the original equations to ensure they satisfy both.
